intro: Rhamnidium ellipticum, commonly known as the elliptic rhamnoid, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rhamnaceae family. It is characterized by its elliptical leaves that are typically glossy and dark green. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually yellowish or greenish in color. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and prefers well-drained soil and full sun. Rhamnidium ellipticum is often found in forest understories and along riverbanks, where it thrives in humid conditions.
